Find out where the candidates stand and vote!
  

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

As a Lamoille County voter, you have a major decision to make as you fill out your primary ballot next Tuesday, August 14.

State's attorneys are elected officials who make life-changing decisions every day with enormous impact on Vermont communities — and they're up for election statewide in 2018. This year, you have the chance to know where the candidates stand on the issues and vote for the person you think will create a better future for everyone in Lamoille County.

Here's how:

  • Check our voter guide to hear from candidates in their own words about criminal justice issues they would face in office, including their positions on the opiate epidemic, police accountability, and severe racial disparities in Vermont's criminal justice system.

  • Watch Lamoille county candidates share their views at our candidate forum, co-hosted with Vermont Law School earlier this month.

  • Visit your MyVoter page on the VT Secretary of State website to confirm your registration and polling place.

  • VOTE on Tuesday, August 14!

State's attorneys have a huge amount of power, but they're also elected officials. That means you have a lot of power too.

See you at the polls!

Sincerely,

Nico Amador
Community Organizer
ACLU of Vermont

Smart Justice Vermont is a nonpartisan campaign of the ACLU of Vermont. The ACLU of Vermont does not endorse or oppose candidates for office.
